Thanks Gordon, your answer helped me out on this one!

The only reason I'm =
tryin to use 2.0.2 is because it allows me to manipulate the precendence of=
 the uris which I kinda need for my project.

Is there any way to do this i=
n 1.14.3?

I think I would switch if there is..because there is defniatly m=
ore docs out there for 1.14.3

...and I'm already runnning into the next pr=
oblem...how can I skip to the post processors in 2.0.2? The method skiptoPr=
cessor() isn't implemented anymore in 2.0.2?

Thanks again,

Georgie

--- I=
n archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> The =
'Key' mechanism is for configurable settings, rather than dynamic 
> state =
that varies for different URIs.
> 
> Instead use the getData() method of Cr=
awlURI to get a 
> HashMap<String,Object> into which you can store arbitrar=
y state for 
> later Processors.
> 
> (This data doesn't survive the URI be=
ing put back onto a queue -- for 
> example if it needs to be retried after=
 certain kinds of errors. For 
> that, or for data that should be 'inherite=
d' by other URIs discovered 
> via the current CrawlURI, look at the addPer=
sistentDataMapKey() or 
> makeHeritable() methods. If using either of these=
, make sure the extra 
> state you add serializes/deserializes cleanly.)
> =

> Also, do you need particular features only present in Heritrix 2.0.2? If=
 
> not, I recommend using 1.14.3; it is still better documented and more 
=
> proven in production environments than the 2.0.x line.
> 
> In 1.14.3, th=
e same general mechanisms exist but the implementing 
> methods/classes are=
 slightly different:
> 
> 2.0.x                        1.14.3
> getData()  =
               -> getAlist()
> addPersistentDataMapKey() -> addAlistPersist=
entMember()
> makeHeritable()           -> makeHeritable()
> 
> - Gordon @ =
IA
> 
> sendaman69 wrote:
> > Hi all,
> > 
> > I'm computing a relevance sc=
ore of each URI based on the HTML content of the URI in a processor and an =
external IE prorgam. I would like to use this score to set the precendence =
for the extracted links of the URI.
> > 
> > How do I add this score to the=
 CrawlURI/ProcessorURI so I can access it in another Processor?
> > 
> > I =
have looked into the Key class but didn't really get the concept of it and =
it seems I only can set on static final values?!?
> > 
> > Hope this makes =
sense...it's kinda late in the night here...
> > 
> > Thanks much in advanc=
e!
> > 
> > Georgie
> > 
> >
